parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power steering system can cause the steering wheel to become stiff or difficult to turn, making it challenging to control the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The steering wheel feels stiff or difficult to turn
the steering wheel wanders from a straight path
the vehicle pulls to one side
the steering system fails to respond to input
the steering wheel becomes loose or has a "notchy" feel
the vehicle drifts into other lanes or the berm.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the fuel pump can cause the vehicle to shut down completely, leading to a loss of power steering and potentially causing accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: all electrical and components fail to function
the steering wheel becomes very hard to turn

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Oil Leaks and Gasket Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine oil leaks can cause engine damage, leading to costly repairs, and potentially lead to engine failure, which can cause accidents or leave the driver stranded.
Coolant pump failure can cause engine overheating, leading to engine damage, and potentially cause a fire, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: smoke or fire from the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Engine Failure and Piston Compression Loss
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine failure can cause accidents or leave the driver stranded, and can lead to costly repairs.
The repeated failure of the fuel pump and engine can cause the vehicle to stall or shut off while driving, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded.
symptoms: and then cuts off; the vehicle stalls or shuts off while driving

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The hesitation and failure of the CVT transmission can cause the vehicle to jerk, hesitate, or delay engaging between gear shifts, leading to hazardous driving conditions, especially on inclines and down slopes.
symptoms: CVT hesitation and delay in engaging between gear shifts
especially on inclines and down slopes; jerking and growling metal noise when accelerating on inclines; rolling back after being at a full stop and slowly accelerating to move forward.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: 8-Speed Automatic Transmission Failure to Shift into 8th Gear
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the 8-speed automatic transmission to shift into 8th gear can cause the vehicle to lose fuel efficiency, increase engine wear, and potentially lead to accidents due to delayed shifting.
symptoms: The transmission does not always shift into 8th gear
even when driving at high speeds; the transmission takes a long time to shift into 8th gear
sometimes taking 18 miles or more; the transmission shifts into 8th gear faster when letting up on the gas pedal after reaching 50 or more mph.
